ygData.subject: flames
ygData.msgSnippet: Mathiew, You can do flame simulations under Windows - there is no need to switch to linux, unless of course you want to for other reasons. Get the two Windows

Mathiew,

You can do flame simulations under Windows - there is no need to =
switch  
to linux, unless of course you want to for other reasons. Get the =
two  
Windows .exe installer files from the sourceforge site (you can follo=
w  
the link from www.cantera.org), and get Python 2.2 from www.python.org =
 
or blue.caltech.edu/cantera_dist,  Install them all, then open the  
fold=
er of Python examples in the Cantera folder on your desktop, and  
run 'fla=
me1.py' or 'flame2.py.'  If you like, edit one of these to set  
your own f=
lame parameters.

Dave G.


On Friday, May 2, 2003, at 05:26 PM, mathieu.wi=
nger1@...  
wrote:

> Mister Goodwin,
> Thank you very much for =
your answer.
> Last time, I read a pdf explaining the paricularities of eac=
h Cantera  
> version (Python, Matlab, C++, ...) and I understood that for =
one  
> dimensional flame simulation like I want to do, it is, for the mome=
nt,  
> ONLY possible with the Python version. So, I suppose that I must fi=
rst  
> install my Linux OS befor Python Cantera because these may not be  =

> possible under any Windows (?).
> What do you think about modelling the =
combustion flame of solid  
> propellants. Could it be easy ?
> With best r=
egards,
> Mathiew
>
> ---------- Initial Header -----------
>
> From      :=
 "Dave Goodwin" <dgoodwin@...>
> To          : cantera@yahoogroups.=
com
> Cc          :
> Date      : Thu, 01 May 2003 00:00:49 -0000
> Subject=
 : [cantera] cantera matlab toolbox
>
> Mathiew,
>
> I think there is a REA=
DME file that explains what to do.  I know
> there is in the source
> distr=
ibution, but I might have left it out of the Windows installer.
>
> In any =
case, run Cantera14.msi, then you will have a folder named
> Cantera, and w=
ithin
> that should be a folder named Matlab. In there is a zip file that i=
s
> the Matlab toolbox.
> Unzip it, start Matlab, and add it to the Matlab =
 path.
>
> It is possible if you are running Windows 98 that your system do=
es
> not have the
> Windows Installer, which you need to run .msi files.  I=
f it doesn't
> run, go to the
> Microsoft web site and search for 'Windows =
Installer'.
> (This is standard on Windows 2000 or later, and is also insta=
lled
> automatically if you
> install Microsoft Office 2000 on older system=
s.)
>
> Hope this helps.
>
> Dave Goodwin
>
>

>>> Canter=
a 1.4 has been released.

>>> 1. Simplified unix bui=
ld procedure. Cantera should build 'out of
> the
>>> box' on linux, cygwin,=
 Mac OS X, and Solaris. If you have Python

he appropriate interface will be built and
> installed

ou can choose the installation directory.

ntera is now hosted by SourceForge at

antera. You can access the

ive.

tation'
